sec.title: The Midwest Nursing Research Society Advances Science to Improve Health
sec.p: MNRS is only as strong and vibrant as its members. There are numerous opportunities within the MNRS organization for members to contribute their talents and expertise. Members of the Board of Directors and the Executive Committee are positions elected each year by the membership. There are, however, a number of opportunities for members to volunteer on committees that contribute to the overall mission of MNRS.

This version of the MNRS News will focus on the many committees that serve the members of the organization. There are many opportunities to get involved in YOUR organization. If you feel like you have something to contribute, or feel like you want to comment on how the organization is being run, volunteering for a committee is a perfect way to let your voice be heard and get involved in MNRS.
A great way to get the feeling for a committee is to attend a meeting at the MNRS annual conference. Most committee meetings are OPEN to any MNRS member.

A listing of the various MNRS committees and a general description is contained below. Be sure to visit the MNRS website for additional information and details, including open committee slots and current committee leadership and membership.

sec.title: MNRS Awards Committee
sec.p: The Awards Committee is responsible for the review nominations for all awards, making recommendations to the Board of Directors for recipients of all awards, including Distinguished Contribution to Research Award, Lifetime Achievement Award, Harriet H. Werley New Investigator Award, Distinguished Service Award, Hartford Institute for Geriatric Nursing/MNRS Award for Leadership in Geriatric Nursing Research Award, and Senior Scientist Award.

sec.title: MNRS Communications Committee
sec.p: The role of this committee is to oversee the development, implementation, and evaluation of a communications plan for increasing the local, regional, national, and international visibility of MNRS and its programs.

sec.title: MNRS Grants Review Committee
sec.p: This committee reviews grant proposals submitted for MNRS sponsored and cosponsored research grants and prepares a written review. It participates in the conference call to agree on the recipient of each grant, including MNRS Mentorship Grant Award, MNRS/CANS Dissertation Research Grant, MNRS Seed and New Investigator Grants, MNRS/ANF Research Grant, and MNRS/STTI Research Grant.

sec.title: MNRS Membership Committee
sec.p: It promotes membership growth for the association, conducts surveys of nonrenewing members as needed to assess the needs of the membership, determines the need for and oversees the membership needs assessment survey, and develops strategies for recruiting and retaining members.

sec.title: MNRS Nominating Committee
sec.p: It is the responsibility of the committee to secure candidates for the ballot and present a slate of qualified, acceptable candidates to the board for approval and to the membership for a vote. The committee members shall consider the specific discussions related to potential nominees to be confidential. Committee members are prohibited from disclosing potential and final nominees to the membership. The committee will conduct its business via meetings, conference calls, email, mail, or fax as deemed necessary by the committee chair. Copies of all committee action notes, minutes, and final correspondence to potential nominees will be forwarded to and retained at the MNRS office. All such documents or communications are strictly confidential.

sec.title: MNRS Program Planning Committee
sec.p: The role of this committee is to develop the conference theme for approval by the Board of Directors, develop goals and related topics for keynote speakers, review evaluations from previous 2 years to identify strengths and address areas in need of improvement and revise evaluation process, structure and organize the annual conference schedule, review and approve artwork/logos for conference proceedings and promotional materials for the annual conference, and form additional subcommittees as needed to complete the work of the Program Planning Committee.

sec.title: MNRS Research Sections Advisory Committee
sec.p: It is the responsibility of this committee to provide assistance to research sections to carry out their goals and objectives. There are also opportunities for MNRS members to serve as either chair or cochair of a Research Interest Group.

sec.title: MNRS Scholarship Committee
sec.p: It is the responsibility of this committee to review applications for all scholarship awards and make recommendations to the Board of Directors for recipients of graduate and undergraduate scholarship awards.

sec.title: MNRS Student Poster Committee
sec.p: It is the responsibility of this committee to review abstracts, establish a cutoff for those posters to be reviewed on-site and participate in the on-site judging of student posters.

sec.title: Emerging Scholars Network (ESN; Formerly MNRS Student Task Force)
sec.p: The ESN represents members of MNRS who are doctoral students and postdoctoral fellows. ESN members serve on selected MNRS committees with the intent of better integrating these members into the organization.

sec.title: Where to Locate More Information on MNRS Committees
sec.p: A full listing of committees, current chair, and committee members can be found on the MNRS website (www.mnrs.org/committees).

Terms of committee commitments vary; be sure to review before agreeing to serve. An application to serve on a committee can be found on the MNRS website (www.mnrs.org/content/committees). Applications are usually due on June 1; committee appointments begin on July 1.

There are many opportunities for MNRS members to be involved in the premiere nursing research organization in the country. By attending the MNRS Annual Research meeting AND volunteering your time and talents, we can ensure that MNRS remains a dynamic organization. Given the number of committees, there is sure to be one that meets the talents of any member. To ensure that MNRS remains a vibrant and meaningful organization, consider volunteering to serve on a committee or task force this year. You won’t regret that you did!!
